column4: hi :D .. so .. how can i tell what version of ubuntu i'm using .. 32 or 64 bits .. and so on ? ? ?
uname -m
32bit
thanks ,, now .. is there a 64bit out there ? .. is it better ??
yes, how much ram do you have?
4gb
if you wanted to use the 64bit version (it's called "amd64") then you could, but you would have to reinstall
thanks .. but .. is there any disadvantages ?
no, not anymore
is it faster ,, where can i compare ?
it's not faster, you can just use more ram
and using more ram .. means ?
32bit can't use more than ~4gb of ram
so .. if my ram are 4gb .. i don't have to reinstall 64bits ,, or i have to ?
you don't "have" to
one more time ,, if my rams = 4gb .. i'm at my best performance ,, and 64bit version ,, won't have any effects ,, ? true ?
it's likely you'll be able to access more ram on 64bit (32bit won't actually address all 4gb for whatever reason)
ooh ,, thanks :) .. so tell me .. is there any good way to "backup" things and "restore" them .. after the new install ?
you don't defragment, you delete your internet history on firefox the same way you do on windows (check firefox menus)
what about defragmentation ,, how dose it work in linux ? ^^
the filesystem doesn't defragment nearly as much for it to be required
arigatou ^^
